edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_game

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_game.Grid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class will be a reference of all of the objects contained in the game. By storing, in a two dimensional array of ints, references to instatiated objects from the game engine. The class itself will not contain any of the objects in play.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        public Grid(int size)
        This will create a square grid with the inputted size. Initially the grid will be set to default values (i.e. 0)
        Parameters:

      • setObjectAt

        public void setObjectAt(int x,
               int y,
               int objectType)
        This meathod will set the object at a specified location to one of the constants definied in the class.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal location of the object where 0 is all the way to the left.
        y - The vetical location of the object, where 0 is the bottom of the grid.
        objectType -

      • setObjectAt

        public void setObjectAt(int location,
               int objectType)
        This method is an alternate way to set an object's position using a single integer between 1 and 81. 1 is the bottom left of the grid, and 81 is the top-right corner of the grid.
        Parameters:
        location -
        objectType -
